intro: Ferula parva, commonly known as the small ferula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are used in traditional medicine and are known for their strong, spicy scent. Ferula parva thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils.
